To the chief Musician upon Muthlabben, A Psalm of David. I will praise <FI>thee<Fi>, O LORD, with my whole heart; I will shew forth all thy marvellous works.
I will be glad and rejoice in thee: I will sing praise to thy name, O thou most High.
When mine enemies are turned back, they shall fall and perish at thy presence.
For thou hast maintained my right and my cause; thou satest in the throne judging right.<RF>maintained…: Heb. made my judgment<Rf><RF>judging right: Heb. judging in righteousness<Rf>
Thou hast rebuked the heathen, thou hast destroyed the wicked, thou hast put out their name for ever and ever.

O thou enemy, destructions are come to a perpetual end: and thou hast destroyed cities; their memorial is perished with them.<RF>O thou…: or, The destructions of the enemy are come to a perpetual end: and their cities hast thou destroyed, etc<Rf>
But the LORD shall endure for ever: he hath prepared his throne for judgment.
And he shall judge the world in righteousness, he shall minister judgment to the people in uprightness.
The LORD also will be a refuge for the oppressed, a refuge in times of trouble.<RF>a refuge: Heb. an high place<Rf>
And they that know thy name will put their trust in thee: for thou, LORD, hast not forsaken them that seek thee.<CM>
Sing praises to the LORD, which dwelleth in Zion: declare among the people his doings.
When he maketh inquisition for blood, he remembereth them: he forgetteth not the cry of the humble.<RF>humble: or, afflicted<Rf>
Have mercy upon me, O LORD; consider my trouble <FI>which I suffer<Fi> of them that hate me, thou that liftest me up from the gates of death:
That I may shew forth all thy praise in the gates of the daughter of Zion: I will rejoice in thy salvation.
The heathen are sunk down in the pit <FI>that<Fi> they made: in the net which they hid is their own foot taken.
The LORD is known <FI>by<Fi> the judgment <FI>which<Fi> he executeth: the wicked is snared in the work of his own hands. Higgaion. Selah.<RF>Higgaion: that is, Meditation<Rf>
The wicked shall be turned into hell, <FI>and<Fi> all the nations that forget God.
For the needy shall not alway be forgotten: the expectation of the poor shall <FI>not<Fi> perish for ever.
Arise, O LORD; let not man prevail: let the heathen be judged in thy sight.
Put them in fear, O LORD: <FI>that<Fi> the nations may know themselves <FI>to be but<Fi> men. Selah.<CM>
